critique: The document is an executive order making conforming amendments to a previous executive order (11023) as a result of the enactment of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps Act of 2002. It primarily deals with the transfer of commissioned officers between uniformed services and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. There is no significant shift in ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The changes are administrative and technical in nature.
